modules.description: This module enables bidirectional conversion between a type `t` and diverse data structures such as strings, lists, arrays, options, and primitive types like integers and floats, alongside XML data represented as `Xml.xml`. It supports error-handled transformations and direct type casting, ensuring safe serialization and deserialization of structured data. Specific use cases include parsing XML content into application-specific types or converting primitive values for interoperability.

Provides functions to generate (de)serializers for data types using ppx syntax extensions, supporting custom drivers for various formats. Works with OCaml types annotated with ppx attributes to enable conversion logic. Used to automatically create JSON, binary, or custom format handlers for structured data.

Converts between type `t` and various data structures including XML, strings, lists, options, and primitives, with error handling and type casting. Supports parsing XML into custom types and serializing primitives for external use. Operations include safe serialization, deserialization, and transformation across data formats. Examples include converting an XML document into a structured record or exporting a float as an XML element.
